alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Coastal York; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 15 at 5:51PM EDT until September 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 PM EDT SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Long period nearshore swells of 9 to 15 feet during high tide tonight building to 12 to 18 feet during the Saturday afternoon high tide. Splash-over expected near high tide tonight with widespread and possibly significant splash-over expected on Saturday. Beach erosion expected. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York, Coastal Cumberland, Sagadahoc, Lincoln, Knox and Coastal Waldo Counties. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 2 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...The splash-over will combine with beach erosion and the partial erosion of vulnerable dunes. Some minor coastal inundation possible tonight with pockets of coastal flooding expected Saturday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
